    • Method Detail

      • getSuggestedData

        public java.util.ArrayList getSuggestedData​(java.lang.String input)
        Method is used to create an array of possible cities user wants to choose. It makes a connection with the database to find Documents that match the query. The method also assigns city IDs to a separate ArrayList that will be later used to fetch the data from the database.
        Parameters:
        input - user input
        Returns:
        ArrayList that consists of city names.

      • getSelectedCityID

        public int getSelectedCityID​(int index)
        Returns city ID
        Parameters:
        index - Index of selected by the user city
        Returns:
        ID of a city.

      • addToDatabase

        public void addToDatabase​(java.lang.String collectionName,
                          com.google.gson.JsonElement currentWeather)
        Method adds a JSON element to the database based on the collectionName.
        Parameters:
        collectionName - Name of the current collection
        currentWeather - JSON element that consists of current weather

      • getLatestDataFromDB

        public org.bson.Document getLatestDataFromDB​(java.lang.String collectionName)
        Method returns the last inserted document to the collection in the database.
        Parameters:
        collectionName - Name of the current collection
        Returns:
        Latest document in the collection.

      • getOXData

        public java.util.ArrayList getOXData​(java.lang.String collectionName)
        Method uses the collectionName to fetch all documents in the collection. Next, it manipulates them to get the 'time' parameter that will be assigned to the OXData ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        collectionName - Name of the current collection
        Returns:
        ArrayList that consists of all 'time' parameters in the collection.

      • getOYData

        public java.util.ArrayList getOYData​(java.lang.String collectionName)
        Method uses the collectionName to fetch all documents in the collection. Next, it manipulates them to get the 'temp' parameter that will be assigned to the OYData ArrayList. Some location have data saved with Integers and others with Double variables, therefore it is necessary to check what type of variable the function is going to assign to the ArrayList. If the 'temp' is a Double it is saved as a Double but when temperature is a Integer it is parsed to 'Double' and assigned to the ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        collectionName - Name of the current collection
        Returns:
        ArrayList that consists of all 'temp' parameters in the collection.

      • getCollectionSize

        public com.mongodb.client.MongoCollection getCollectionSize​(java.lang.String collectionName)
        Method uses the collectionName to fetch the collection.
        Parameters:
        collectionName - Name of the current collection
        Returns:
        MongoCollection based on the collectionName

      • getCollection

        public com.mongodb.client.FindIterable<org.bson.Document> getCollection​(java.lang.String collectionName)
        Method uses the collectionName to fetch the collection.
        Parameters:
        collectionName - Name of the current collection
        Returns:
        FindIterable containing all documents in the collection based on the collectionName
